description: How to deploy Nuxt on Platform.sh?

--- template: guide title: Platform.sh description: How to deploy Nuxt on Platform.sh? target: Static & Server category: deployment logo: light: "/img/companies/square/light/Platformsh.svg" dark: "/img/companies/square/dark/Platformsh.svg" --- # Deploy Nuxt on Platform.sh How to deploy Nuxt on Platform.sh? --- [Platform.sh](https://platform.sh/) is a full-featured end-to-end continuous deployment cloud hosting system for both staging and production environments. It is capable of hosting both static and dynamic applications in a variety of languages. Platform.sh includes the following features: - Build, deploy, manage, and scale applications. - Any branch can be a staging environment; create and delete environments with ease. - Support for almost any Node.js, PHP, Python, Ruby, Go, or Java application, in your choice of version, or mix and match. - Automatic TLS certificates. - Integrated build pipeline to customize your application's build process however you need. - Infrastructure-as-code: define three YAML files and your entire cluster is created on demand. Add and remove services with ease. - Deploy code directly from your GitHub and GitLab repositories. ## Setup Platform.sh has a pre-made template for Nuxt available. The link below will create a new Platform.sh project and pre-populate it with a sample Nuxt application that you can then customize.

The `README.md` file includes details of the provided default configuration. New Platform.sh accounts are free for the first 30 days.
